question_text: Which of the following statements defines education best ?
options: (A) Education is a means of social change
(D) It generates a lot of employment

question_text: Semester system is recommended as it is considered to:
options: (A) help students learn more efficiently and be regular
(B) reduce examination orientedness and increase emphasis on learning
(C) provide scope for continual appraisal and on course correction in teaching-learning process
(D) allow for more creative ways of teaching

question_text: It is said that teachers must enable students to own the responsibility for learning. This means teachers
options: (C) ask students to study on their own
(D) must help students to evolve one's own ways of learning

question_text: At higher education stage emphasis needs to be on, not only 'what' and 'how much' is learned by students but 'how' and 'how well' they learn. This idea is expressed at present as:
The current thinking of assessing students only at the end of the term is less relevant as it :
options: (A) reveals student's learning in respect of subject matter
(B) concerns with how accurately one recollects the subject matter
(C) may reveal 'temporary learning' and not beyond
(D) assesses student learning on 'what is asked' rather than 'what is learned' even beyond subject matter

question_text: Arrange the following from the least difficult to most difficult: (1) Teaching of processes (2) Teaching of values (3) Teaching of concepts (4) Teaching of thinking skills
Recently a separate Board has been established to monitor all ... education institutions in Gujarat.

The increasing number of entrants into higher education has necessitated changes in our views of teaching learning. Some progressive institutions have faced this through the adoption of multimedia for teaching-learning. This means, the use of ... for teaching learning.
options: (B) face to face, distance and open learning (ODL) systems
(C) ODL, face to face, satellite and web based modes

question_text: Apart from specialisation in one's subject areas, products of higher education are also expected to be ... in the context of national development.
options: (A) sensitive and proactive towards emerging concerns and issues
(C) aware of the economic changes especially the job market

question_text: To ensure quality maintenance in universities and colleges guidelines and regulations are periodically prepared by the ... at the national level.
options: (B) National Council for Educational Research and Training (NCERT)

question_text: The open university at the national level in India is known as:
Three kinds of universities in India are:
options: (A) State Universities, Central Universities, Affiliating Universities
(B) Unitary Universities, Technical Universities, General Education Universities
(C) State Universities, Central Universities, Private Universities
(D) Central Universities, State Universities, Deemed Universities

question_text: A condition or characteristic that can take on different values or categories is called:
A researcher wants to find out the relationship between gender and intelligence among high school students. This would be :
The best graphical way to present data related to different levels of a certain variable is:
In simple terms 'reliability' is the:
options: (B) appropriateness of interpretation based on test scores
(C) ways in which people are the same
(D) rank order of participants on some measure

question_text: A researcher was interested in studying why learning of new maths was not effective in schools during 1990s. For this, he interviewed several teachers who had taught new maths at that time. These teachers were ... for his study.
A positive correlation is present when:
options: (A) two variables move in opposite directions
(B) two variables move in the same direction

question_text: What is the % of increase in number of candidates choosing chemistry from 1993 to 1994?
What is the % of fall of number of candidates in Biology from 1992 to 1993?
In which subject the strength (in %) was least in the year 1993 ?
What is the largest number of students employed through campus recruitment ?
What is decrease in number of students going for further studies during 2003-05?
How many students choose other activities in 2004?
How has new technology contributed to enrich the competencies of Indian students in the field of IT?
options: (A) Indian students go to foreign universities in large number to study IT
(B) The new technology has enabled them to study IT in India
(C) Indian government is promoting the new technology
(D) Our students have established good contacts with developed countries.

question_text: In the globalized India human resource development is accelerated by:
options: (C) Opportunities for higher education are limited to rural areas

question_text: In a fast changing society, firm political commitment is essential to:
Of the following ... is not a factor affecting the speed of globalization.
options: (D) A high speed growth in knowledge

question_text: What might happen if we fail to create a just and humane society?
options: (A) The programmes for human resource development would fail
(C) The process of globalization would break down
(D) Globalization and liberalization would create economic imbalance

question_text: Find out the results of privatization of education in India, from the following: (1) Higher education has become accessible to rural students. (2) The pace of human resource development has increased. (3) Many low quality colleges have come up. (4) The quality of medical and engineering education has improved a lot.
EDUSAT refers to:
options: (A) Satellite based transmission channel meant for educational purposes
(B) A television channel providing education and entertainment
(C) A non-commercial television channel operated by cables
(D) An educational channel operated through universities

question_text: Teachers must not only be effective communicators but they should also:
options: (D) develop the same (effective communication) in students

question_text: The most preferable type of communication in the classroom is:
'Nodding' is a cue for ... communication.
Which of the following is not a communicative situation in the classroom?
options: (A) copying down the points written on the blackboard
(B) standing up when teacher enters the classroom
(C) looking down when teacher asks a question

question_text: The major barrier in communication process is:
options: (A) sender's poor knowledge of the topic of communication
(B) receiver's negative attitude towards the sender
(D) lack of perceptible feedback from the receiver

options: (C) Unavailability of nuclear waste disposal methods
(D) Exposure of radiation during normal running of a nuclear plant

question_text: Green-house effect is increasing due to:
options: (B) Change in number of green-house gases
(C) Change in concentration of green-house gases
(D) Melting of glaciers and dry atmospheric conditions

question_text: Arrange the following gases in decreasing order of their concentration in atmosphere: (1) Oxygen (2) Nitrogen (3) Carbon dioxide (4) Argon
Reduction in global warming is possible with:
options: (C) reduction in use of fossil fuel
